definition: (coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
surname Shan

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: If you're on a bad date, make up some excuse and get the heck out of there.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的約會很糟糕，那就編造一些理由閃人吧。

sentences.english: Why did you have to go?
Let's bail, this place is dead.

definition: at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to cease to be faithful
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
(Tw) from time to time/frequently
to run around all over the place
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
get out of here!/beat it!
depending on the situation
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
